page.title: Manually Creating a Dump File
page.description: In some cases, Alpha Technical support will require you send in a dump file that was manually created.

section.title: Creating a Dump File for Alpha Anywhere Application Server
section.description: To force a dump file to be created from the Alpha Anyhwere Application on Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows Server 2008, or Windows Server 2008 R2, follow the instructions below.

step.description: Run task Manager (you can start task manager by right clicking on the desktop task bar and selecting "Start Task Manager").
Right click with the mouse and choose "Create Dump File" from the context menu.

description.p: The standard task manager is a 64-bit process and creates 64-bit dumps of 32-bit processes which Visual Studio does not like.
To create a 32-bit dump, you can run the 32-bit task manager (c:\Windows\SysWOW64\taskmgr.exe.)
To get a 32-bit dump file on a 64-bit version of Windows for a 32-bit process:
You can confirm that the task manager is the 32-bit version because the Image Name column will have an entry with the value "taskmgr.exe *32".

step.description: Right click with the mouse and choose "Create Dump File" from the context menu.
